sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
The obedie[n]ce of a Christen man and how Christe[n] rulers ought to governe, where in also (if thou marke diligently) thou shalt fynde eyes to perceave the crafty conveyance of all iugglers. Obedience of a Christen man. Tyndale, William, d. 1536.
clx, [8] leaves
the seconde daye of October. Anno. M.CCCCC.xxviii, by me Hans luft [i.e. J. Hoochstraten], [At Marlborow in the la[n]de of Hesse [i.e. Antwerp] : [1528]]
By William Tyndale. The imprint from colophon is false; actual place of publication and printer's name from STC. Includes index. Reproduction of the original in the Bodleian Library.
=======
